Flub.Name: Save to Build Folder
Flub.Description: Saves the output to build folder. Will igonore the above path if this option is checked.

Flub.Name: File
Flub.Description: Path where the output files should be saved

Flub.Name: Wavefront OBJ
Flub.Description: Wavefront OBJ output

Flub.Name: XYZ Point Cloud
Flub.Description: XYZ Point Cloud output

Flub.Name: Autodesk FBX
Flub.Description: Autodesk FBX output

Flub.Name: Scale
Flub.Description: The scale for the model.

Flub.Name: Normalized (0.0 - 1.0)
Flub.Description: Writes vertex values to the 0.0 to 1.0 range. This is the easiest for resizing to any scale, or for easy interpretation in OBJ importers in many DCC applications.

Flub.Name: 1 Unit = 1 Meter
Flub.Description: Writes vertex values in meters. NOTE: Many OBJ importers will fail to read large numeric values produced by this option.

Flub.Name: 1 Unit = 1 Kilometer
Flub.Description: Writes verte values in kilometers. Unlike the above option, most OBJ importers are able to read the values as they tend to be double digit at most.

Flub.Name: Vertex Count
Flub.Description: The number of vertices on either axis.

Flub.Name: Structure
Flub.Description: The mesh synthesis method to use for the model.

Flub.Name: Tris
Flub.Description: The terrain will be produced with uniform triangles.

Flub.Name: Quads
Flub.Description: The terrain will be produced with uniform quads.

Flub.Name: Tris (Adaptive)
Flub.Description: The terrain will be produced using perpendicular triangles but with automatic polygon density as required by different portions of the terrain. This method produces the best outcome.

Flub.Name: Create Texture Coords
Flub.Description: Creates texture coordinates in the output mesh.

Flub.Name: Create Walls
Flub.Description: Creates wall in the output mesh.

Flub.Name: LOD
Flub.Description: Number of LODs to be generated along with main mesh.

Flub.Name: None
Flub.Description: No LODs

Flub.Name: LOD 1
Flub.Description: One LOD

Flub.Name: LOD 2
Flub.Description: Two LODs

Flub.Name: LOD 3
Flub.Description: Three LODs

Flub.Name: LOD 4
Flub.Description: Four LODs

Flub.Name: LOD 5
Flub.Description: Five LODs

Flub.Name: LOD 6
Flub.Description: Six LODs

Flub.Name: LOD 7
Flub.Description: 7 LODs

Flub.Name: LOD 8
Flub.Description: 8 LODs
